sheet.stakes: The mercenary company faces winter starvation unless they secure passage and winter quarters, while the defending lord must prove his feudal competence—failure to defend his lands invites future predation and questions his legitimacy among vassals and overlords alike. This is fundamentally a test of feudal order against mercenary desperation.
sheet.constraints: The defending lord cannot negotiate passage without appearing weak to his feudal superiors and inviting future mercenary incursions. The mercenary company cannot retreat without facing certain winter death, eliminating any possibility of tactical withdrawal.

side_a.equipment: Professional mercenary kit: mail hauberks with coifs, steel caps or early bascinets, crossbows with pavises, falchions and war hammers, reinforced leather boots, smaller heater shields optimized for mobility

side_b.supply_state: adequate but time-constrained - winter deadline forces immediate action
side_b.equipment: Mixed feudal levy: padded gambesons, leather jerkins, scattered mail shirts among sergeants, longbows and hunting bows, spears, axes, falchions, large wooden shields reinforced with iron, simple steel caps and kettle hats

terrain_weather.defining_feature: Muddy ford with steep banks on defender side. Woods on attacker's left flank.

features.name: Muddy Ford Bottleneck
features.description: The crossing point forces attackers into a narrow column vulnerable to concentrated fire
features.tactical_impact: Attackers cannot deploy in line formation while crossing; defenders can concentrate missiles on predictable approach routes

features.name: Defender's Elevation Advantage
features.description: Steep banks provide commanding height over the ford approach and crossing
features.tactical_impact: Missile weapons gain increased range and accuracy downhill; attackers fight uphill in mud while exposed

features.name: Flanking Woods
features.description: Dense woodland on the attacker's left offers concealment but restricts formation movement
features.tactical_impact: Enables surprise flanking attempts but prevents coordinated charges; defenders must split attention between ford and woods

events: Mercenary feint begins crossing under covering fire
Main flanking force enters woods on left
Defenders rain missiles on ford crossing
First mercenary wave takes heavy casualties but establishes foothold

decision_points.situation: Faces defended ford with 2:1 advantage but tactical disadvantage
options: Feint at ford while main force flanks
decision_points.chosen: Feint at ford while main force flanks
decision_points.rationale: Cannot afford frontal casualties with winter approaching, must use tactical skill to overcome terrain disadvantage
decision_points.consequences: Splits force but preserves strength for decisive action

decision_points.situation: Scouts report movement in woods while ford assault begins
options: Hold position and trust terrain advantage
Detach force to counter flanking movement
decision_points.chosen: Detach force to counter flanking movement
decision_points.rationale: Cannot allow mercenaries to gain rear position, must prevent encirclement
decision_points.consequences: Weakens main line just as ford assault intensifies

decision_points.situation: Must commit to crossing while under increasing missile fire from concealed positions
decision_points.information_available: Can see the ford and some defenders, but cannot assess full defensive strength or positioning
decision_points.execution_risk: Once committed to crossing, cannot easily redirect forces or withdraw under fire

decision_points.timestamp: When first mercenary wave enters the water
decision_points.situation: Must decide when to reveal full defensive strength and begin concentrated fire
decision_points.information_available: Can observe enemy approach and estimate numbers, but cannot know their true desperation or commitment level
options: Early engagement to maximize casualties in water
Wait until more enemies are committed
Focus fire on officers to break command
decision_points.execution_risk: Levy troops may break if they take heavy casualties or if mercenaries reach the bank
